topics.title: Overview
topics.description: Course introduction, objectives, and a high-level overview of agentic programming.

topics.title: What is Agentic Programming?
topics.description: Defining agentic programming and its role in modern software development.

topics.title: Traditional Programming vs. Agentic Paradigms
topics.description: Comparing the execution flow and design philosophies of traditional and agentic systems.

topics.title: The Rise of LLMs and Agentic Systems
topics.description: Understanding how the capabilities of LLMs enable the development of autonomous agents.

topics.title: Core Concepts: Agents, Goals, and Autonomy
topics.description: Exploring the fundamental components of an agentic system and the concept of autonomy.

topics.title: The Iterative Loop: Plan, Act, Observe
topics.description: Deep dive into the foundational iterative cycle that drives agent behavior.

topics.title: Why Agentic Programming Matters
topics.description: Discussing the benefits, challenges, and transformational potential of agentic systems.

topics.title: Use Cases and Applications
topics.description: Reviewing diverse real-world applications where agentic programming excels. Include VSCode Copilot as example. Discuss its architecture in detail.

topics.title: Ethical Considerations in Agentic Systems
topics.description: Addressing the ethical implications and responsibilities in developing autonomous agents.

topics.title: Setting Up Your Development Environment
topics.description: Guidance on configuring the necessary tools and libraries for agentic development.

topics.title: Introduction to Python for Agentic Systems
topics.description: A quick refresher on Python features essential for building agentic applications.

topics.title: Basic LLM Interaction
topics.description: Hands-on practice with basic API calls to interact with large language models.

modules.title: LLMs as Reasoning Engines & Prompt Engineering Fundamentals

topics.title: Understanding Large Language Models
topics.description: Exploring the architecture and capabilities of LLMs that make them suitable for agentic tasks.

topics.title: The Role of LLMs in Agentic Systems
topics.description: How LLMs serve as the core reasoning and decision-making component for agents.

topics.title: Prompt Engineering: Guiding LLM Behavior
topics.description: Introduction to the art and science of crafting effective prompts to steer LLM responses.

topics.title: Basic Prompting Techniques
topics.description: Under the module of LLMs as reasoning engines and prompt engineering. Create a top that covers fundamental methods for constructing prompts, including clear instructions and role-playing.

topics.title: Few-Shot Prompting
topics.description:
Leveraging examples within prompts to teach LLMs new tasks or output formats.

`Context`: in a module named LLMs as reasoning engines & prompt engineering fundementatals. Following a topic on basic prompting techniques.

topics.title: Zero-Shot Prompting
topics.description: Techniques for getting LLMs to perform tasks without explicit examples.

topics.title: Temperature and Top-P: Controlling Creativity
topics.description: Understanding parameters that influence the randomness and determinism of LLM outputs.

topics.title: System Prompts vs. User Prompts
topics.description: Differentiating between instructions for the LLM's persona and direct user queries.

topics.title: Designing Effective Prompts for Agents
topics.description: Strategies for creating prompts that enable agents to perform complex reasoning and actions.

topics.title: Prompt Chaining and Sequential Prompts
topics.description: Building multi-step reasoning by linking prompts together.

topics.title: Evaluating Prompt Effectiveness
topics.description: Methods and metrics for testing and refining prompt designs.

topics.title: Prompt Engineering Best Practices
topics.description: A summary of guidelines for developing robust and reliable prompts for agentic systems.

modules.title: Tools, Actions, and the Model Context Protocol

topics.title: Introduction to Tools in Agentic Systems
topics.description: Understanding what tools are and why they are essential for agent functionality.

topics.title: What are Tools and Why are They Important?
topics.description: Exploring the concept of tools as functions that agents can invoke to perform specific actions.

topics.title: Defining Tool Functions
topics.description: Practical guidance on how to structure and implement functions that agents can call.

topics.title: The Model Context Protocol: How LLMs Use Tools
topics.description: Understanding the standard interface and communication mechanism for LLMs to interact with tools.

topics.title: Tool Descriptors and Schemas
topics.description: Learning to define tool capabilities and required parameters using structured formats.

topics.title: Integrating External APIs as Tools
topics.description: Connecting agents to web services and third-party APIs through custom tools.

topics.title: Creating Custom Tools for Specific Tasks
topics.description: Developing bespoke tools to handle unique requirements not met by existing services.

topics.title: Tool Selection and Usage Strategies
topics.description: How agents decide which tool to use and when, based on their current goal and context.

topics.title: Handling Tool Outputs and Errors
topics.description: Strategies for processing results from tool executions and managing potential failures.

topics.title: Tool Orchestration in Workflows
topics.description: Designing sequences of tool calls to achieve complex objectives.

topics.title: Security Considerations for Tools
topics.description: Best practices for securing agentic systems that interact with external services.

topics.title: Building a Simple Agent with a Single Tool
topics.description: A practical exercise to implement an agent capable of using one external tool.

topics.title: The Challenge of Stateless LLMs
topics.description: Understanding why LLMs, by default, lack memory and how this impacts agents.

topics.title: Introduction to Agent Memory
topics.description: Overview of different types of memory an agent can possess: short-term and long-term.

topics.title: Short-Term Memory: Context Window Management
topics.description: Techniques for managing the limited context window of an LLM to retain recent interactions.

topics.title: Long-Term Memory: Vector Databases
topics.description: Introduction to vector databases as a persistent storage for agent knowledge.

topics.title: Understanding Embeddings and Vector Search
topics.description: How text is converted into numerical vectors and efficiently searched for semantic similarity.

topics.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Explained
topics.description: A detailed breakdown of the RAG paradigm: retrieve relevant info, then generate a response.

topics.title: Building a Basic RAG System
topics.description: Step-by-step guide to constructing a simple RAG pipeline.

topics.title: Chunking Strategies for Documents
topics.description: Methods for dividing large documents into manageable pieces for effective retrieval.

topics.title: Indexing and Storing Information
topics.description: Best practices for populating and maintaining vector databases.

topics.title: Querying and Retrieval Techniques
topics.description: Optimizing queries to retrieve the most relevant information from memory.

topics.title: Advanced RAG Patterns
topics.description: Exploring sophisticated RAG architectures, such as recursive or self-reflecting retrieval.

topics.title: Evaluating RAG Performance
topics.description: Metrics and methodologies for assessing the effectiveness of a RAG system.

topics.title: Introduction to Agent Architectures
topics.description: Overview of common design patterns for structuring autonomous agents.

topics.title: The ReAct Pattern: Reasoning and Acting
topics.description: Detailed exploration of the ReAct (Reasoning and Acting) framework for agent control.

topics.title: Implementing ReAct Agents
topics.description: Practical steps to build agents using the ReAct prompting strategy.

topics.title: Chain-of-Thought (CoT) Prompting
topics.description: Techniques for guiding LLMs to generate intermediate reasoning steps.

topics.title: Combining CoT with ReAct
topics.description: Synergistic approaches to integrate Chain-of-Thought reasoning into ReAct agents.

topics.title: Planning: Decomposing Complex Tasks
topics.description: Strategies for agents to break down high-level goals into executable sub-tasks.

topics.title: Action: Executing Steps with Tools
topics.description: How agents select and utilize tools to perform planned actions.

topics.title: Observation: Evaluating and Correcting
topics.description: Mechanisms for agents to assess the outcome of actions and identify areas for correction.

topics.title: Self-Correction Mechanisms in Agents
topics.description: Designing agents that can detect and recover from errors or suboptimal outputs.

topics.title: Iterative Refinement Loops
topics.description: Building agents that continuously improve their output through repeated planning, action, and observation.

topics.title: Multi-Agent Systems: Introduction
topics.description: Foundational concepts for designing systems where multiple agents collaborate.

topics.title: Designing Agentic Workflows
topics.description: Principles for structuring complex, multi-step processes driven by agents.

topics.title: Introduction to Agentic Frameworks
topics.description: Overview of popular frameworks that streamline agent development and orchestration.

topics.title: Overview of LangChain and LangGraph
topics.description: Understanding the LangChain ecosystem and the role of LangGraph for stateful multi-actor applications.

topics.title: Building Graphs with LangGraph
topics.description: Fundamentals of defining nodes and edges to create directed acyclic graphs for agentic flows.

topics.title: Nodes and Edges in LangGraph
topics.description: Detailed explanation of how to construct computational steps (nodes) and transitions (edges).

topics.title: State Management in LangGraph
topics.description: How LangGraph manages and passes state between different nodes in a workflow.

topics.title: Conditional Logic in LangGraph Flows
topics.description: Implementing dynamic routing and decision-making within LangGraph workflows.

topics.title: Introduction to CrewAI: Collaborative Agents
topics.description: Overview of CrewAI and its approach to building multi-agent systems with predefined roles.

topics.title: Defining Agents, Tasks, and Crews in CrewAI
topics.description: Learning to set up specialized agents, assign tasks, and orchestrate them into a crew.

topics.title: Orchestrating Agent Collaboration with CrewAI
topics.description: Techniques for enabling agents to work together, share information, and refine outputs.

topics.title: Tool Integration in CrewAI
topics.description: How to equip CrewAI agents with tools to perform external actions.

topics.title: Comparing LangGraph and CrewAI
topics.description: Analyzing the strengths, weaknesses, and ideal use cases for each framework.

topics.title: Choosing the Right Framework
topics.description: Guidance on selecting the most appropriate framework for specific agentic projects.

modules.title: Advanced Agentic Patterns, Testing, and Deployment

topics.title: Advanced Planning Strategies
topics.description: Exploring sophisticated planning algorithms and techniques for agents, beyond simple task decomposition.

topics.title: Hierarchical Agents and Sub-Agents
topics.description: Designing agents that can delegate tasks to specialized sub-agents for modularity and scalability.

topics.title: Human-in-the-Loop (HITL) Agentic Systems
topics.description: Integrating human oversight and intervention into agent workflows for validation and complex decision-making.

topics.title: Building Robust and Resilient Agents
topics.description: Techniques for making agents more fault-tolerant and capable of handling unexpected situations.

topics.title: Testing Agentic Systems
topics.description: Developing strategies and tools for unit, integration, and end-to-end testing of agents.

topics.title: Evaluation Metrics for Agents
topics.description: Defining quantitative and qualitative metrics to assess agent performance and output quality.

topics.title: Debugging Agentic Workflows
topics.description: Techniques and tools for identifying and resolving issues within complex agentic processes.

topics.title: Monitoring Agent Performance
topics.description: Setting up monitoring systems to track agent behavior, resource usage, and success rates in production.

topics.title: Deployment Strategies for Agents
topics.description: Best practices for deploying agentic applications to various cloud and on-premise environments.

topics.title: Scalability Considerations
topics.description: Designing agentic systems that can handle increased load and complexity.

topics.title: Security Best Practices for Production Agents
topics.description: Implementing security measures to protect agentic systems from vulnerabilities and misuse.

topics.title: Future Trends in Agentic Programming
topics.description: Discussion of emerging concepts, research directions, and the evolving landscape of agentic AI.

modules.title: Capstone Project: Building a Comprehensive Agentic System

topics.title: Introduction to the Capstone Project
topics.description: Overview of the capstone's goals, requirements, and project options.

topics.title: Project Scope Definition and Goal Setting
topics.description: Guidance on defining a clear problem statement and measurable objectives for your agentic system.

topics.title: Designing the Agentic Architecture
topics.description: Planning the overall structure of your agent, including its components and interaction flows.

topics.title: Choosing Tools and APIs
topics.description: Selecting and integrating appropriate external tools and APIs for your agent's functionality.

topics.title: Implementing Planning and Reasoning Components
topics.description: Developing the LLM-driven logic for task decomposition, decision-making, and self-correction.

topics.title: Integrating Memory and RAG
topics.description: Building and incorporating a memory system, potentially using RAG, for long-term knowledge.

topics.title: Developing Collaborative Agents (if applicable)
topics.description: For multi-agent projects, designing the interaction and collaboration protocols between agents.

topics.title: Building the Core Workflow with a Framework
topics.description: Implementing the agent's main execution flow using LangGraph, CrewAI, or another chosen framework.

topics.title: Testing and Debugging the System
topics.description: Applying testing methodologies and debugging techniques to ensure agent functionality and reliability.

topics.title: Evaluating Project Performance
topics.description: Assessing the agent's effectiveness against the defined project goals and metrics.

topics.title: Refining and Optimizing the Agent
topics.description: Iterating on the agent's design and implementation to improve its performance, efficiency, and robustness.

topics.title: Presenting Your Agentic Solution
topics.description: Guidelines for documenting and presenting your capstone project, highlighting its design, implementation, and results.
